lead_paragraph: Both Gov. Rick Snyder and Gina McCarthy, the administrator of the United States Environmental Protection Agency, were repeatedly pressed on their responsibility in the lead contamination scandal.

headline.print_headline: Michigan Governor Tells Congress He Was Misled on Flint Water
headline.main: Michigan Governor Tells Congress He Was Misled on Flint Water

snippet: Both Gov. Rick Snyder and Gina McCarthy, the administrator of the United States Environmental Protection Agency, were repeatedly pressed on their responsibility in the lead contamination scandal.
abstract: Michigan Gov Rick Snyder, appearing before Republican-led House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, answers scathing questions from his own party about his lack of action in Flint, regarding reports of tainted drinking water; EPA administrator Gina McCarthy is also questioned and both officials are called on to resign.
